summary:
American English (AmE) is the type of English spoken in the United States. It's the most common language there and is used in government, schools, and businesses. Many U.S. states (32 out of 50) have made it an official language. American English is now the most important form of English worldwide.

It has unique pronunciation, words, grammar, and spelling compared to other English dialects. The accent varies across regions, but "General American" refers to accents without strong local influences, often heard in media and among well-educated speakers. While some local accents are fading, new regional accents have developed over the 20th century.
title: American English
